Description
SUMMARY

Analyze and document the structural integrity of detail, assembly, and installation drawings along with design alterations and repairs for commercial helicopter systems.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES include the following:
  • Performs structural analysis of both metallic and composite structures used in aerospace applications.
  • Analyze new and existing designs for all components of the helicopter including metallic/composite structure and mechanical subsystems.
  • Analysis includes hand, computer aided calculations and FEA.
  • Flight Strain Survey Instrumentation Definition, Pre-/Post-Flight Data Processing and Analysis.
  • Define bench testing, design test fixtures and instrumentation requirements of components and assemblies.
  • Perform analysis to substantiate alterations, repair and rework of rotorcraft structures.
  • Perform mechanical vibration analysis and interpret results of dynamic systems.
  • Other duties may be assigned
SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES

None
Qualifications
SKILLS AND ABILITIES REQUIRED
  • Must have working knowledge of structural analysis concepts and applications.
  • Must have working knowledge of static, dynamic and fatigue analysis of rotorcraft.
  • Must have working knowledge of statistical tools utilized for failure analysis.
  • Must have knowledge of composite structures analysis and metallic structures analysis.
  • Familiarity with Helicopter airframe and flight loads required.
  • Ability to write test plans and reports.
  • Ability to work in a team environment to support engineering goals and objectives.
  • Knowledgeable in MATHCAD, UG NX, PV-WAVE, NASTRAN/FEMAP, UG Scenario (or equivalent).
  • Requires strong team-orientation and the ability to work several assignments concurrently.
  • Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite to include Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Access.
  • The ability to understand and follow instructions and the ability to concentrate.
  • Excellent written, verbal, communication and interpersonal skills.
  • The ability to get along with others or to be part of a team.
  • FAA Structures DER, DER experience or ability to achieve designation is preferred.
  • Access to Export Control Information required.
  • Regular attendance at the work-site required..
EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE
  • Bachelor's degree (B. S.) from an accredited four-year college or university, and 10-14 years related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
  • Advanced Engineering degree (M.S.E) preferred.
